intro: Hieracium glaucinum subsp. subalatum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the alpine regions of Europe, it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils at high elevations. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has a compact, bushy appearance. It is often found in mountainous habitats and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
